Reviews.Title: “Always so good”
Reviews.Author: Goelans
Reviews.Content: Just back... Always same hotel... The Aziyade hotel... I enjoyed my stay, always same impression to feel good, breakfast on the top floor with terrace and all the flowers are always so pleasant, spring is back at the hotel... relaxed atmosphere. Staff available, hammam very correct, everything was great, I'm in a hurry to go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Will NEVER stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Madeleine S
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our holiday to Istanbul and was happy with the city, but not with the Aziyade hotel. First of all, when we arrived the first night we were told "there was a problem with the room" and we had to be relocated to another hotel. The next morning I found out that they had overbooked the hotel and that was the reason for us having to move. I understand that hotels sometimes makes mistakes and has to relocate people, but our room was pre-paid and I had already informed the hotels 3 times in the last to weeks before our arrival that we would have a late arrival. They could have told us then that they we would have to stay at another hotel the first night instead of telling us at 2 am when we arrived dead-tired after a long day of traveling. The Aziyade hotel was actually paid double for our room that night... our pre-paid money and the other guests rate for that night. They offered us a buffet dinner to make up for it. This buffet was old, stale and almost empty and they did not make an effort to fill it up for us. We had to pay for the drinks, even for water even though the dinner was suppose to be on the house. The restaurant staff was unplesant when they found out that the meal was on the house. Management at this hotel is ONLY concerned with making money and this is the feel you get from all the staff aswell. We asked for recommendations for restaurants in Istanbul. I specifically asked for a nice place, not too "touristy". The reception staff gave med 4 brochures to 4 highly tourist-places - the reason? these places pay the Aziyade hotel to send customers. We tried one of those restaurants by accident for lunch one day and the food was ok'ish (iÂ´m being kind), way too expensive in regards to how much food we got and they gave us service charge upon service charge. (it was the Hamdi restaurant in Haminonu). The feel of the place was awful, just tourists and almost junk-food restaurant feel. Our stay in Istanbul was good, not because of the Aziyade hotel, but in spite of it. We used other hotels and other locals for advise on restaurants and cafes. The hotel was just somewhere we slept, the rooms were clean enough, but very small. The staff in the whole hotel was unplesant and rude at times and I would not recommend anyone to stay here. Don't jeopardize your stay by choosing this hotel. There are so many other hotels in Istanbul - it's not worth it to choose this one and taking the chance that the staff might try to ruin your stay too. We really aren't difficult guests, we just want honest advice and a hotel staff that smiles and offer genuine service. When they offer something complimentary it has to at least be acceptible in terms of standard, otherwise it would just feel like another kick in the back.

Reviews.Title: “Your perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: First_Advice
Reviews.Content: The hotel's servise was great The breakfast was A+. We stayed later in Golden Crown - no comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, nice place”
Reviews.Author: bette1stl
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying here quite a bit. The rooms, although small, were very clean and comfortable. The place was clean and the building was modern, and the rooms were equipped with free wifi. Shower was hot and lovely. The Turkish delight turndown service and free tea in the lobby were an added pleasure, and the breakfast buffet was very good. Location is okay, although I'd rather stay in Circegi for its proximity to tourist sites, although this location in Sultanhamet is quieter. Staff wasn't particularly helpful and seemed a bit disinterested in customer service. That said, we liked the place and would again, and thought it was pretty nice for around $100 U.S./night.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Erkan E
Reviews.Content: It is a nice Hotel to be in. Firstly, the location, it is between Sultanahmet and BeyazÄ±t(grand bazaar), booth places are in walking distance, BeyazÄ±t is around.,8min., Sultanahmet around.10-12min.. Secondly, it is clean and the food in the restaurant is great, the prices are amazing too. The rooms are quite, not too big in the same time not too small either. Beds are soft, there is a air conditioner for cold or in my case hot, hair dryer is wall mounted, there is always new soaps and mini shampooâ€™s. They have an free, ADSL connection, a TV with multi lingual channel choice, free safe in room. The only thing that you should consider is, the window views are not that great, only the upper rooms and the restaurant have sea view, as far as I know. The staff is helpful, some of them need to smile a little bit more maybe but all around thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beedee23
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the recent reviews. My husband and I stayed for 6 nights with a group. We found nothing to fault. The staff, atmosphere, and food all contributed to a very enjoyable stay. The hotel's location in the centre of the major tourist attractions, and the ease of travel by local bus or tram made for a stress free holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmospheric hotel”
Reviews.Author: tiggerfrankUk
Reviews.Content: From being greeted with glasses of spiced tea our whole stay was very pleasurable. The hotel has a real Turkish atmosphere with super paintings and furnishings in the lobby/bar area. Free hot spiced tea or cold lemonade was always available and, from 5-7pm free Turkish nibbles are placed in the bar. The restaurantr/breakfast room is on the 7th floor with terrific views out over the sea of Marmara. The breakfast buffet takes up the whole length of the room with a vast selection on offer. It was impossible to sample everything in the six days there. Fresh fruit salad, juices including sour cherry, hot Turkish sausage with scrambled egg; cutting sections of real natural honeycomb to go with delicious yoghurt especially good, but there was so much more; cucumber, olives and novel cheeses an interesting variation. The same restaurant in the evening has a super buffet or a la carte at amazingly cheaper prices than surrounding cafes. Free wifi was good and worked in bedroom, lobby and restaurant. and there is a free computer and printer, so boarding passes can be easily printed. Bedrooms are on the small side but spotlessly clean, and beds were very comfortable. The basket of different local soaps in the bathroom was a nice touch, as was the nightly Turkish delight left on the bed each evening. Staff were friendly and very helpful. In all a delightful place to stay, very well situated off the main tourist route but close to key sites like Topkapi, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and the Grand Bazaar.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SonjaBirnbaum
Reviews.Content: Great location, near to the major touristic attractions, nice clean rooms, friendly staff, good breakfast and a wonderful view over the Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: Staffs are all friendly. Nice cozy location, 5 minutes from cultural attractions. The rooms are quite small. They clean the room and give new towels every day. No tea- making facilities in rooms. The breakfast was good although it could have been richer. Wireless network was very weak.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOSPITALITY - BEAUTIFUL VIEW”
Reviews.Author: ziyaoner
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Aziyade 4-5 times this year. Everytime I felt like I was at home. They have a great crew..A very soft and friendly service.Room service and restaurant prices are very reasonable. The terrace restaurant has maybe the best view in Istanbul, great panorama, quality live music, no extra charge! Shortly I love Aziyade, my second home in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and views”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travel1308
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aziyade Hotel for part of our honeymoon. The location was great- so close to everything. It also had breathtaking views from the rooftop hotel restaurant. The rooms were clean but small- especially for American standards. It didn't bother us though, it was all we needed since we were only staying a few days. The staff could have been better- not very helpful and not many speak English. The internet service was awful, even though they promote it in their brochures. We stayed in Istanbul before going to Athens exactly during the week they had all of the transportation strikes in Athens. We were trying to book new air flights over the internet and it kept cutting us out! We even tried to go use it around 3am, and it still wasn't working.

Reviews.Title: “Jenny & Bryan”
Reviews.Author: Jenny B
Reviews.Content: Very good stay at Aziyade hotel... Friendly staff and warm greeting. Hotel is very clean ... no complaints... We will go back there for our next WE to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, great service but breakfast needs more local flavour”
Reviews.Author: DGJS
Reviews.Content: For a first time visitor who spent a week here the location was great for walking or if you prefer an easy tram ride to all of the primo sites - Topkapi, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Spice Mkt, Underground Cistern, Hagia Sophia, Hippodrome, Turkish and Islamic Arts Museum, Istanbul Archaelogical Museum, Mosque of Sulyman the Magnificant (uphill big time), Sirkeci (Orient Express) Train Station, although the Galata Tower/Bridge, Istikial Street & Taksim Square - still walkable by the very enthusiastic - are better reached by taking the tram to Kabatas and the funicular to Taksim square and then walking from Taksim Sq down Isttikal Street to the Galata Tower and over the Galata Bridge to the old town (or taking the tram across the Galata Bridge from Karacoy to Cemberlitas) and then walking to the hotel or ???. We found the room to very good, not too small, ok view of the street out front but you cannot drink the water in the hotel, so we bought 2 6-packs of 1.5 L bottles for the stay from nearby stores. Prices vary but about 10 lira per 6pack seems right. Shower pressure was excellent as were the soaps, shampoos... The turn down service Turkish Delights were excellent, I regret not asking them where they got them, as the pre-boxed ones we brought home were not even close in texture or flavour. Bar, front desk, restaurant service were all very good+ and speaking only English was not a problem at all. The view of the Sea of the Mamara was very nice from their dining room and the two dinners and lunch we had there were very good. However, breakfast had limited local influence except for the cheeses, yogurt and a few of the breads. The scrambled eggs were wet, the "sausages" were what North Americans would call cheap beef wieners in Campbell's tomato soup. I found the juices, apple tea and an unsweetened hot chocolate excellent. The fruit, coffee and other teas were ok. All in all we should have gone out for breakfast more often, but we were limited because on three mornings we had tour buses picking us up and the timing just didn't work. There are many restaurants in all price ranges, which are an easy (easier than the main sites) walk away and 5-6 convenience stores in the area, which apply the "variable pricing" business model - it's based on what you look like, what you want, who's serving you... The differences shouldn't be much and you probably will not buy much from them but to reduce the surprise factor I thought I would just let you all know. Istanbul was fantastic and we very much enjoyed the three Koptur bus tours that were included with our Air Transat package. Bottom line - would I stay here again - a definite yes.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: arul f
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good hotel, good location, middle of the city. The good part is it is well in the city. you can go any where by walking.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean, great service!”
Reviews.Author: MsGemSeeker
Reviews.Content: Located very near the Grand bazaar and Burnt Column, this hotel was very comfortable, clean and staff was very friendly. Great for business trip. It was cold outside so the rooftop restaurant was enclosed and heated, food was delicious and plentiful. Very cozy. Great view of the Marmara Sea.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: donald m
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel as a package with Air as a last minute getaway, so we weren't expecting a five star Hotel. This Hotel is a good 3 star Hotel that is walking distance to a lot of sites. Yes, you have to walk up a steep hill, but all of Istanbul is like that. Rooms were clean and staff was very helpful and accommodating. My wife and I loved the rooftop for breakfast, which had a nice selection of meats,cheese and honey for a typical Turkish breakfast. The rooms can be small, but we only went there to sleep. Nice little touches every night when they came around with a little newsletter, a few Turkish phrases and Turkish delight. Nice little hotel to discover an interesting city.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy”
Reviews.Author: KarenAS17
Reviews.Content: The room was small and dark, but it was very clean. Our main issue with the room was that the toilet was broken and would not stop running for hours at a time (including overnight). Based on the pictures we saw online, we expected that the rooms would be more modern than they turned out to be. But again, everything was clean and the room had all of the essentials. The best part of this hotel was breakfast on the roof. The food was delicious, the options plentiful, and the view unbelievable. That said, we visited the rooftop restaurant for tea one afternoon expecting a cup of traditional Turkish tea; instead, we got two cups of hot water with Lipton's teabags, which was pretty disappointing. It's true that the hotel is down a pretty steep hill, but assuming you are in reasonable shape, it is only a minor inconvenience. The only time the hill became more of a problem was when we were leaving Istanbul and needed to drag our suitcases up the hill.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marcdb
Reviews.Content: i spent 5 days there at easter... it's in a central location a the bottom of a steep hill which is ok if you can walk back up... The hotel was very good. the staff spoke english, the room i had was a good size with air conditioning which was needed in the heat. The restaurant on the 8th floor was also good with a nice view across the city towards the sea. The breakfast was a buffet with more than enough choice. the best pert for me was the Turkish bath in the basement. I had a sauna and a steam bath with a massage for 25 euros.. all in all a nice hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Solibella
Reviews.Content: Just back from a trip to the wonderful city of Istanbul. The hotel was about right for our requirements - quiet, comfortable, clean and conveniently located for Sultanahmet - and good value for money. Our rooms were fine, if a little small and the beds were a bit hard but not uncomfortable. The staff were friendly although, on reception, they were a bit vague and strangely didn't seem to know very much about Istanbul! Generally, though, the hotel was very nice and we would recommend it. A complementary cool drink on return from a busy, hot day was always welcome. The breakfast spread is very good but it is virtually the same spread every day - not a problem for a few days but we would have welcomed more variety as we stayed at the hotel for a week. The evening buffets were good value at 30 lira (about Â£12 per head).

Reviews.Title: “Down the hlll”
Reviews.Author: Prahaaussie
Reviews.Content: Staff was not very friendly ... Hike up and down the hill only to find comparable hotels closer to main drag and much nicer ....like the sultanahmet area .... just did not like the small rooms with the view of brickwalls and when asked to be moved to a room with some view we got rooftops !!!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: DAHarvey1957
Reviews.Content: Recently my wife and I stayed at the AziyadÃ© Hotel, Istanbul. Everything about it was first class! The rooms are spacious, well-equipped and comfortable. The breakfasts were of a superb quality and there was a huge variation of fruit, cereals, eggs and pastries. The coffee was delicious too! And all this on the top floor reastaurant overlooking the Bosphorus. You are a few minutes walk from the historical heart of Istanbul and an efficient tram service running down to the golden horn. Everybody goes out of their way to give you five star service. We shall definitely be staying at the AziyadÃ© on our next trip to this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel-service, great extras, location”
Reviews.Author: enjoythemoment155019
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Aziyade was great. The hotel was lovely, very clean and well cared for. It had extras like free beverages in the lobby, snacks in the late afternoon, good breakfasts, wonderful dinner buffets, wonderful bar and restaurant on a flower-filled rooftop with a fabulous view of Istanbul. Our room was very nice, clean and fresh with a great view of the town and Turkish delight candy in the evening. Servers in the restaurants, lobbies, etc worked very hard to please. The location was very close to all the sights, a very easy walk to the tram and felt very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Schlockette
Reviews.Content: we stayed here 3 nights. the first night our room was very small and it was a quick in and out. we had requested a larger room but were told that all rooms were the same. then we came back a week later and were put in room 504 and it was much nicer in that it had more room and a nice desk area (though no light at the desk, so it made it hard to see at night on my PC). the bathroom was nice also. the breakfast was good and they had nice cut up fruit. also the view was great. the internet connection was very good. the location is great. easy to walk to the grand bazzar and the blue mosque. we walked at night and were fine. the gym is just a few pieces of equipment. nothing much. i did not use the spa. the men at the front desk seem to know more than the women. all in all it was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “A very friendly and comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrisybrad
Reviews.Content: We greatly enjoyed our stay here. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The hotel was very comfortable and our rooms were cleaned immaculately each day. Free Turkish tea and nibbles were provided each evening in the relaxing lobby area. The food was plentiful and varied with buffet style meals. We were pleased to be there in April before Istanbul and the hotel are at their busiest.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for exploring Istanbul and lovely friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: HCF628
Reviews.Content: Prime tourist attractions are within easy walking distance, as are a number of good restaurants and the very efficient tram service. The staff here all spoke excellent English (and French for that matter) and were always helpful, friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff , perfect location and great value”
Reviews.Author: mostafa_elguindi
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last November , i really enjoined staying there its very nice a very great location near blue mosque and hagia sofia , near tram station easy to find a taxi , i really recommend it to any one want to visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location, clean room, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: faeriewings09
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent 6 nights at the Aziyade. Our room was very nice. The beds were comfortable. The bathroom vanity had plenty of room for 2 girls' stuff. Great shower pressure! We were on the 6th floor and had beautiful views across Sultanahmet and of the Marmara Sea. The breakfast was very nice - eggs, fruit, yogurt, cereal, coffee, tea, cheese, sliced meats, olives, tomatoes, and the variety breads - wonderful! Honey, jams, butter and preserves. The staff were friendly and happy to help with booking tours, answering questions about directions and helping with language pronunciation. The hotel has a hammam - which we did not use, but looked clean and professional. For the money, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “We had a very pleasant stay and service”
Reviews.Author: ErikaandBrian
Reviews.Content: I first was a bit skeptical after viewing somewhat negative comments about this hotel, but all my doubts vanished at the very first moments of our arrival. Staff was very friendly; reasonable rates; neat and comfortable rooms. Would definitely recommend Aziyade Hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was heilpful views are great”
Reviews.Author: Gladys4412
Reviews.Content: Staff was heilpful views are great

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel- a delightful base for exploring Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: helen168
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is special. From the welcome drink (soft) served in the foyer to the large comfortable lounges to relax in while waiting for your room, the bedtime turkish delight treats and the magnificient roof top garden restaurant which serves excellent buffet breakfasts and dinners. It is walking distance to the blue mosque , grand bazzar, and sancta sophia.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: John2015
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is initially hard to find, once you know its location (among all the shoe sellers in Sultanahmet), it's a nice place to cool your heels after a day of sightseeing in Istanbul. Within walking distance of the Grand Bazaar, the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia, it's also close to the tram which takes you everywhere in Istanbul. The rooms, while small, are cosy and very clean and the double bed in my single room (which took up most of the room) was quite comfortable. The towels and included toiletries are nice and every evening the staff leaves a newsletter and a small treat of Turkish Delight on the bed. I paid approximately $100.00 US per night which seemed reasonable. Warning: the hotel serves a lot of tour groups, so you'll see big groups of people speaking French and Italian, but it's a nice place and the included breafkast on the 7th floor sports breathtaking views of the Sea of Marmara and surrounding area. This hotel is a good find. Plus free WiFi is included!

Reviews.Title: “Well located, clean and good service.”
Reviews.Author: Bellavance
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the Aziyade in late September / early October 2010. Great location near the tramway. Water in rooms is potable, a rarity in Turkey. Helpful service and nice breakfast in a room with terrace and a very nice view of the Sea of Marmara. Ask for a room on the 6th floor for unblocked view.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located quality hotel with very few flaws.”
Reviews.Author: BernerBaer
Reviews.Content: This quiet 4-star hotel is centrally located, a few minutes' walk away from the major sights in Sultahnamet. The city center is easily and safely reached by way of the Piyerloti street, but the surrounding smaller streets to the north are steep, not very clean and full of cheap, shabby shops - single women travellers may prefer to avoid that area at night. The rooms are very small, clean and functional. My fourth-floor room was equipped with air conditioning - a must in July - and a wall-mounted TV with bad satellite reception of a few international channels. The view was disappointing, consisting mostly of the shabby workspace - a sort of tailors' shop? - in the house opposite, although as with the streets one might appreciate this as a certain local flair. Free wireless internet access is available throughout the hotel, but the signal was not strong enough for my iPad in my room. An internet PC with printer is available in the lobby. The staff are polite and helpful. The hotel tries hard to make its guests feel welcome, offering complimentary drinks and mezes in the lobby and distributing a daily inhouse newspaper (with a small box of "Turkish Delight") to each room. The decor is inviting, but the kitschy oil paintings of nude harem women in the public areas might not be to everybody's taste. Breakfast is adequate, but it's served on a seventh-floor terrace with a great view of the southern Bosporus and the sea of Marmara. On the whole, I've felt that I've received very good value for the EUR 57 per night I've paid, and may well stay at this hotal again should I ever return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lesmanone
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located for those who want to visit Istambul, near Hagia Sofia , the Blue Mosque, the Grand Bazar, Topkapi palace and other mosques, monuments and museums. The view from the top floor restaurante is fantastic. Here you canhave breakfast , lunch and dinner overlooking the Sea of Marmara and th Blue Mosque, and believe me having dinner at the sunset listening to call for prayer of the surrounding mosques is fantastic. The staff is helpefull and they do have sense of humor, you just have to know how to make them laugh.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bland breakfast and lousy aircondition”
Reviews.Author: Skjeldsen
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location for sightseeing and is within walking distance of most of the sights. The area is quit at night and without much traffic. The rooms were Ok but a bit small but Ok for a single traveler. The air-conditioning didnâ€™t cool the room so I had to open the window which was Ok in May but must be bad later in the season. The lighting outside the rooms was a bit dark and only switched on when motion was detected. The breakfast was served on the rooftop restaurant with a fine view of the ocean. The breakfast buffet was not very interesting but you could get omelets by paying extra.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vasilis26
Reviews.Content: Hotel Aziyade was a really nice hotel, I really enjoyed myself staying there. Its location is perfect in order to do sightseeing, very close to TopKapi, Agia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Theodosian Walls etc. but also right next to a tram station, so you could easily go anywhere you wanted. Rooms were quite nice, clean, sheets and towels changed every day, satellite TV breakfast was just fine and of course, what better than start your day and have your breakfast on the restaurant on the top floor with views to the entire city till the sea? People were friendly and helpful, and generally I would stay again if I went back in Costantinople.

Reviews.Title: “Old city hotel, close to sight seeing...”
Reviews.Author: Terry_in_Victoria
Reviews.Content: The hotel was Ok. Had free internet on the mezzanine. The hotel room intself was small and faced out to what appeared to be a sweat shop. The room was clean, had tv and airconditioning. The hotel is a couple blocks from the grand bazaar and the mosques. The hotel is in the old city on a hill so the walks are a good workout. We stayed only one day here and was a good location to check out the attractions. Then we relocated hotels to the new part of the city where we could do shopping and have more options for restaurants etc. The hotel staff were not very helpful when we checked in as we had just been on a 10 hour bus from Khusadasi on the coast and we arrived at the hotel at like 9 AM. We were very tired and understood that check in wasn't until 1pm, but there had to be a room that the people had checked out of early. No attempt was made to help us, but when the shift changed and new staff arrived the gentleman found us a room.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good experience”
Reviews.Author: Aussiedemon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located in a quiet position in the Sultanhamet area only 10 minutes walk from Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar and the "Cisterns" (amazing Roman reservoir). Staff were friendly and helpful. Free Internet was good. Rooms not large but quite adequate with good bathroom. The only downer with this hotel is the complete lack of air-conditioning (cooling). It appears the system has broken down for the entire hotel. Consequently rooms were hot and stuffy. A window could be opened and the gale force air entering soon cooled the room down but this is not a satisfactory fix. If staying there in the summer I would recommend you establish that the aircon has been repaired. The restaurant on the top floor has fabulous sea and city views and is well laid out. We ate there for both breakfast and dinner and found the food to be very good, reasonably priced and with excellent service. Wine was priced 25 to 28 lira for good quality. A very good reasonably priced hotel but check re aircon if staying in summer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Azouma
Reviews.Content: I stayed for several nights at the Aziyade Hotel in the Sultanamet area of Istanbul. The hotel was booked through a tour with Pacha Tours. I thought the hotel was super. Good location, friendly staff, excellent restaurant on the 7th floor overlooking the harbor. That being said, this was the last hotel I stayed at as part of the tour, and it was a cut above the rest of the places I stayed, so understandably, I was very pleased with it. Here is a note about Pacha Tours. If you are looking for a reasonably priced tour to Turkey, definitely consider Pacha Tours. The itineraries they offer are great, the places we stayed were fine, and the restaurants were all good. Just keep this in mind, it is not a luxury tour. Some of the resaturants in the more rural areas will be in beautiful areas along a river bank or in the beautiful countryside, but they will be a little rustic. If you order fish, it will probably come cooked with a head and tail attached. You can always avoid that by ordering the chicken kebob, though. The hotels were all clean and safe, although not always in the most convenient locations. But be assured you are not spending a lot extra for a room you'll only spend one night in, anyway. Some of the hotels exceeded my expectations, such as the Aziyade in Istanbul, and the hotel in Cannakale. If your expectations are in line with what you are paying for the tour, you will have a fabulous trip with Pacha Tours.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for long weekend in historic part of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: RJB29
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Aziyade Hotel for 5 nights to celebrate our wedding anniversary. On arrival, the staff were friendly, helpful and checked us in quickly to a very pleasant room with partial sea view - not a huge room but perfectly adequate as we were out a great deal. Breakfast on the 7th Floor terrace is idyllic and would be hard to beat. Hotel is very well located for both Sultanhamet - Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace, plus easy reach of the Grand Bazaar. OK it is 200m uphill to the tram stop but then Istanbul is a hilly place and it is good exercise! In the looby bar - where drinks are very reasonably priced - there are complemtary fruit juices and early evening meze to help yourself. We tried many local restuarants and our favourite turned out to be but a few hundred metres from the hole - the Ortaklar - outstanding Turkish food. Thoroughly recommend this hotel - quiet, clean, helpful staff and perfectly adequate room. Also very handy having free wireless internet all ovedr the hotel - plus a free use desktop computer on the 1st Floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: platanita4
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the description look amazing; in reality, it doesn't look so much like that. This hotel is walking distance from the Blue Mosque and Hippodrome Square. The hotel is actually located on a busy, steep, tiny, and crowded street. I was impressed with the lobby and the hot tea upon arrival. That faded when we went to our room. Our room was tiny. It was either us or the suitcases. Everything seemed clean except for the yellow-ish, dingy pillow covers. On our last night in the hotel, we asked for a 4:00AM wake up call in order to be at the airport on time. They never called us. Luckily, we had a back-up alarm clock. The food in the restaurant was ok. It wasn't a horrible experience, but it was not a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definately not 4 stars...try 2”
Reviews.Author: JHLAust
Reviews.Content: I think we must have stayed in a different hotel than the previous guests as I honestly can't say many great things about the hotel. The hotel is located in the less nicer part of Sultanhamet and you only need to go a few streets north or east of the hotel and things seem a lot nicer. The streets are quite cobbly and uphill into the main attractions of the Blue Mosque etc (on the positive side, its downhill on the way back to the hotel). In fairness, when we arrived at 3pm on Thursday, we were greeted by a complimentary hot Turkish tea and face cloth. That was about as nice as it got though. The reception staff on the 3 or 4 occassions we tried to get information were not very helpful. They weren't very informative about the Tours on offer, how to get to places and didn't speak very good english either. We actually booked our tours from another hotel further along as they made time to tell us what they had. The rooms are basic, dated and small. Beds are hard but all in all, if all you need is a place to sleep, then they are fine. You certainly don't feel the need to go back to the rooms to relax. Word of caution on the taxis...a taxi ride from the airport to the hotel should be no more than 30lira. From the hotel to the spice markets about 7 liras and over the bridge to the new town area about 15 lira. If you ask them how much, they will quote highly inflated figures...we paid 28 lira for a 10 minute ride to the spice market! If you ask them to run the meter, they have multiple meter readings and one must be for tourists as on another occassion it cost us 25lira. Given the airport is at least 4 times the distance, it doesn't make sense that a quick trip costs the same! We got duped again despite our insistance to use the meter. We then spoke to some locals who told us how much taxis should cost so for the third taxi ride we told them how much we would pay, and they accepted it! Never again, did we pay more than 15 lira (and that is still higher than their local fares) for a city trip. The most appaling thing though was the note switch trick. On 2 different occassions the taxi driver told us that we had underpaid him and switched a 10lira note for a 1 lira note. When this happened the second time, we stood firm that we hadn't underpaid as we counted our money before we got into the cab and he finally left us alone...wiser passengers! Despite the taxi and hotel debacles, we did enjoy Istanbul as it is a different city to Europe with lots to offer. Its such a shame that there were a few bad incidents, however we can start to laugh now...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Japanese Food”
Reviews.Author: TBIRDMAN
Reviews.Content: This was a great hoyel, great location, great food, clean,staff freindly and helpful. The rooms where a bit small but very nice. The top floor is a resturant don,t stay right under it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Aziyade, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: grinningdog
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four days during February and although the weather wasn't very nice, Istanbul is an exciting and unusual place to go for a City break. The Hotel Aziyade is a decent 4 star (so British 3 star) hotel with courteous reception staff and comfortable (if a bit small) rooms. We had a double on the 5th floor with views over the Bosphorus and it was fine. Excellent buffet style breakfast in the hotel's restaurant on the top (7th floor) with brilliant views of the city. The Aziyade is a 4 minute walk (up a steep, cobbled street) to Istanbul's 'Oxford Street'. From there you are minutes from the Grand Bazaar and a short tram ride to The Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace etc. You can walk if you prefer but we were surprised that Istanbul is made up of some very steep hills and the pavements are a bit dodgy with treacherous, gaping cellar entrances waiting to swallow you every few feet. The Aziyade is near the bottom of one such steep hill, but we highly recommend this hotel for a decent City break.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in the old city”
Reviews.Author: George_StonyBrook
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Aziyade Hotel for 10 nights after booking via their web site. This is the off-season and the price was 50 euros per night and included breakfast and free transportation to and from the airport. I have been to Istanbul many times and have always stayed in â€œname brandâ€� hotels in the Taksim district of the city. This was the first time staying in the old city. The hotel is conveniently located about a 10 to 15 min walk to the Blue Mosque / Hagia Sophia / Topkapi Palace and a Tram (street car) station. The walk is through narrow streets and up-hill for the first 5 minutes â€“ so if you have difficulty walking you may want to take a cab. The hotel was very well maintained and clean and the staff was excellent. They offer a free breakfast, which was very good, and we ate dinner in the restaurant a few times and the food again was excellent and was at a reasonable price. The guest rooms vary in size quite a bit. I had asked for a non-smoking room and the only one available was too small for two people â€“ or in my opinion â€“ one person. We were given a much larger room but on a smoking floor. The room had an adjoining room and the wall between the two rooms was quite thin â€“ we could easily hear the other guests talking in a regular voice. Luckily, the guests went to sleep by 10 PM and our sleep was not disturbed. Also, we found the bed very hard â€“ if you like a soft mattress this may be a problem. We did not make use of the Turkish bath or Sauna because of a 10 euro per person charge after 4:00 PM. We did go down and have a look at the facilities â€“ they were quite small â€“ their fitness centre consists of one stationary bike, one rowing machine, and one treadmill. However, from looking at other hotels in the old city â€“ it is clear that space is at a premium and I do not think you would find larger spa facilities at other hotels in this part of the city. They also had a very nice floor with meeting rooms and sitting rooms and free use of one computer for E-mail. The view from the hotel restaurant was very nice â€“ you could see the Bosphorus and part of the old city. Overall we would highly recommend the Aziyade Hotel when staying in the old city of Istanbul. The positives by far outweighed the few negatives and we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: lsavoy
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Istanbul where we stayed 3 nights at the Aziyade hotel. I had booked online and upon arriving there in the morning, they assigned the exact room we had requested and our room was ready in 15 minutes. The reception staff was courteous and friendly. Our room was on the 5th floor with an ocean view. It was very clean with two large windows. We could walk to all the visiting sights in 10 minutes. Be prepared to walk on cobblestones, up and down, maze-like streets. The complimentary breakfast served in the panoramic restaurant, was very good,-everything from cereals, fruits, croissants, eggs, meats. The only thing which deceived us was the jacuzzi- barely lukewarm, which we would have highly appreciated after so much walking. Would highly recommend this hotel- good value for the price. Savoie, from Canada

HotelInfo.Name: Aziyade Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Piyerloti Cad. No:30, Istanbul 34490, Turkey
